content.body:
Nice spot.
It's built using eleventy so we should probably just mention that, rather than calling it a "Jekyll alternative"

content.body: the appeal of having it stated there might've been due to there being so many people already familiar with that publishing workflow (many feel skilled enough to work on it), but it might not be such a bad idea to leave out any opinionated stack details on the second line there. eleventy's tag line (as seen on their github repo's description) is "A simpler static site generator. An alternative to Jekyll." -- that was my rationale, but happy to pr any correction you all would prefer https://github.com/11ty/eleventy
